subject: Politics
title: Economic Rebuilding
description: A quick, practical guide to Economic Rebuilding.

hook.text: Revolution destroys before it creates. Factories close, investors flee, and economies crash before recovery begins.

buildup.text: Post-revolutionary economies face collapse. Capital flight, broken supply chains, and sanctions cripple growth.

discovery.text: The Marshall Plan rebuilt Europe after World War II. Foreign aid can accelerate recovery when it's well-designed.

twist.text: Russia's post-Soviet economic 'shock therapy' created oligarchs and poverty. Speed without safety nets was brutal.

climax.text: Economic failure after revolution breeds disillusionment. People who fought for freedom get frustrated by poverty.

punchline.text: Freedom without prosperity breeds anger. Economies must follow revolutions.

quiz.question: What happened during Russia's post-Soviet 'shock therapy'?
options: Rapid privatization created oligarchs while most citizens fell into poverty
The economy grew steadily and equally
